roleset.name: enumerate
roleset.note: COUNT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'count' based on financial subcorpus; nominal 'counting' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls estimate-34.2, multiply-108. (from count.01-v)
COUNT-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to count.01-v. Vn classes estimate-34.2 and multiply-108. Framed by Katie. (from count.01-n)
COUNTING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from counting.01-n)

example.name: count-v: Count von Count
example.text: But this is a production designed and directed by Franco Zeffirelli and paid for by Sybil Harrington, who-1 [*trace*-1]-2 has no need *trace*-2 to count her pennies .

example.name: counting-n
example.text: During this " General Election " , especially on the eve of election , on the date of the election and at the time of vote counting , the entire Taiwan was in a more calm , rational and harmonious atmosphere compared with the past .

roleset.name: include
roleset.note: COUNT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls characterize-29.2. Updated by Julia,12/2010. (from count.02-v)

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: count-v: with group
example.text: Mr. Achenbaum has counted among his clients some of the most visible blue-chip advertisers in the country, including Nissan, Toyota, Seagram and Backer Spielvogel clients Hyundai and J.P. Morgan.
example.arg: some of the most visible blue-chip advertisers in the country, including Nissan, Toyota, Seagram and Backer Spielvogel clients Hyundai and J.P. Morgan

example.name: count-v: no group
example.text: *trace*-1 Not counting the extraordinary charge, [the company]-1 said it would have had a net loss of $3.1 million, or seven cents a share.

roleset.name: rely, depend
roleset.note: COUNT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls rely-70. (from count.03-v)

roles.note: There's as least one example where treebank misparses "count on" as aphrasal verb rather than verb+preposition. Use [count] [on]as thepredicate in that/those example(s). (from count.03-v)

example.name: count-v: no secondary predication
example.text: Before the union rejected the company's offer and the strike was launched with the graveyard shift of Oct. 4, Boeing had been counting on turning 96 aircraft out the door in the present period.
example.arg: on turning 96 aircraft out the door in the present period

example.name: count-v: with secondary predication
example.text: Commodore had been counting on its consumer business to stay sufficiently healthy to support its efforts in other areas -- mainly in getting schools and businesses to use its Amiga, which has slick graphics yet has been slow to catch on because it isn't compatible with Apple Computer Inc. or International Business Machines Corp. hardware.
example.arg: to stay sufficiently healthy to support its efforts in other areas -- mainly in getting schools and businesses to use its Amiga, which has slick graphics yet has been slow to catch on because it isn't compatible with Apple Computer Inc. or International Business Machines Corp. hardware

roleset.name: matter
roleset.note: COUNT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls matter-91. Updated by Julia,12/2010. (from count.04-v)

example.name: count-v: positive
example.text: `` What-1 *trace*-1 counts is the bottom line . ''
